p: The tested essential oils showed high to moderate lipoxygenase inhibitory activity (IC 50: 26.26 ± 0.04 µg/mL, 28.40 ± 0.02 µg/mL and 32.42 ± 0.15 µg/mL for leaf, trunk bark and fruit oils, respectively) when compared to standard Quercetin (21.57 ± 0.10 µg/mL) ( Table 5). These results show that Z. leprieurii essential oils have anti-inflammatory properties, as has also been previously described with Z. leprieurii growing in different places [ 65, 66].
